content: Hi, I'm looking at https://github.com/PatrickMassot/plastexdepgraph to use dependency graph for a latex file without leanblueprint. I couldn't get how it works. I assumed \usepackage{depgraph} is not enough. Is there anyone who used it before?
Iâ€™d be happy to help but I need more information about you tried and what went wrong.

Thanks! I didn't use plastex before, maybe that's why I couldn't manage to compile. I already installed leanblueprint for another reason, and I updated the latex. I added '\usepackage{depgraph}' to a basic latex file, but the file was not compiled by saying "no depgraph.sty found". When I read more about plastex, as far as I understand, I should compile the latex file via plastex + adding plastexdepgraph. But I don't know how to do so. Do I have a misunderstanding? Sorry if it's very silly mistake :)

For people reading this thread: I forgot to return to this question, but Elif sent me a private message reminding me, so I fixed a little bug and updated the documentation at https://github.com/PatrickMassot/plastexdepgraph/blob/master/README.md
